Package gameobjects

Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NonStaticObject, StaticObject
public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A GameObject is the class used to create any GameObject, it uses a lot of parameter, such as a Vector2 position that refers to the position in the window.

Another Vector2 size that is how big the GameObject will appear. Linked to that is the HitBox that by default will be the same size as the size but can be changed. Check HitBox to see how it's created.

Then there's the String imagePath, that's what image is going to be used to represent the GameObject. And an integer degree, that is the rotation applied to the image of the GameObject. The Room room is next variable on the list, that stores what Room the GameObject will be in.

Lastly there's the Color color, and integer transparency, used when there's a need to apply a transparent color on top of GameObject. Usually a gameObject is created with child class and not by itself.

See Also:
HitBox, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GameObject​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, @Nullable Room room)
    Constructs a new GameObject, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument, whose room is specified by the Room argument.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameObject

      public GameObject​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, @Nullable Room room)
      Constructs a new GameObject, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument, whose room is specified by the Room argument. Note that the room is the only variable that is nullable, and is only null when creating the Hero.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new GameObject
      size - the size of the new GameObject
      imagePath - the imagePath of the new GameObject
      room - the room the new GameObject will be in
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless both position and size aren't null

  • Method Details

    • drawGameObject

      public void drawGameObject()
      Draws the gameObject based on it's position, imagePath, size and degree.

      If a color is specified then it uses StdDraw.picture(double, double, String, double, double, double, Color, int) to draw a transparent filter of the color on top of the GameObject.

    • collide

      public boolean collide​(GameObject object)
      Checks if the GameObject hitbox is colliding with another GameObject.
      Parameters:
      object - the GameObject you want to check collision with
      Returns:
      true if the hitboxs are colliding, false otherwise.

    • collideWithPosition

      public boolean collideWithPosition​(Vector2 position, GameObject object)
      Checks if the GameObject hitbox is colliding with another GameObject, at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the GameObject you want to test
      object - the GameObject you want to check collision with
      Returns:
      true if the hitboxs are colliding, false otherwise.

    • isSameInstance

      public boolean isSameInstance​(GameObject object)
      Checks if this GameObject is of the same instance as the other GameObject.
      Parameters:
      object - the GameObject
      Returns:
      true if the instances are the same, false otherwise.

    • legalPosition

      public boolean legalPosition​(Vector2 position)
      Returns whether or not a position is legal. Which is legal if the position is not colliding with any other object in the room.
      Parameters:
      position - the position for the object
      Returns:
      true if the position is legal, false otherwise.
